data.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
data.text: Workout of the Day 26.10.2025 WODDAILYSWEAT For Quality 6 Rounds 3:00 Row/Ski Erg 20 Box Stepups 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16) 10 Ring Rows Sweat: 16/8 Train: 20/12 Compete: 24/16"
data.full_text:
Workout of the Day

26.10.2025

WOD
DAILYSWEAT


For Quality
6 Rounds
3:00 Row/Ski Erg
20 Box Stepups
15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
10 Ring Rows


Sweat: 16/8
Train: 20/12
Compete: 24/16"

ai_explanation.explanation:
Workout Overview


Hey everyone! Todayâ€™s WOD is all about quality and endurance. Weâ€™re going to be working through 6 rounds of a mix of rowing or skiing, box step-ups, kettlebell sumo deadlift high pulls, and ring rows. This workout is designed to build your aerobic capacity, leg strength, and upper body pulling power, all while keeping a focus on form and quality of movement. Letâ€™s break it down step by step!


---


Workout Components


1. Row/Ski Erg (3:00)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • For the Row: Sit on the rower, strap your feet in, and grab the handle. Start with your arms extended, knees bent, and back straight.
  • Push through your legs, lean back slightly, and pull the handle to your chest, keeping your elbows close.
  • Reverse the motion: extend your arms, lean forward, and bend your knees to return to the starting position.
  • For the Ski Erg: Stand tall, grab the handles, and start with your arms extended overhead.
  • Pull the handles down towards your hips while bending your knees slightly, then return to the starting position.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.
  • For rowing, focus on driving with your legs first, then pulling with your arms.
  • For the Ski Erg, maintain a neutral spine and avoid leaning too far forward or backward.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • If youâ€™re new to rowing or skiing, reduce the intensity by focusing on technique rather than speed.
  • You can also switch to a stationary bike or a light jog if needed.

    • ---


    2. Box Step-Ups (20 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Stand facing the box with your feet hip-width apart.
  • Step up onto the box with one foot, driving through your heel to lift your body up.
  • Bring your other foot up to meet the first on top of the box, then step back down one foot at a time.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your chest up and engage your core as you step up.
  • Make sure your entire foot is on the box to avoid slipping.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Use a lower box if youâ€™re not comfortable with the height.
  • You can also perform step-ups without weights to focus on form.

    • ---


    3. Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (15 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed out.
  • Hold the kettlebell with both hands in front of you, arms extended.
  • Hinge at your hips and lower your body to grab the kettlebell, keeping your back straight.
  • Drive through your heels to stand up, pulling the kettlebell up towards your chin, elbows high.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep the kettlebell close to your body as you pull it up.
  • Engage your lats and core to maintain stability.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Use a lighter kettlebell if youâ€™re new to this movement.
  • You can also perform the movement without the kettlebell to practice the motion.

    • ---


    4. Ring Rows (10 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Set the rings at a height where you can comfortably reach them while standing.
  • Grab the rings and lean back, keeping your body straight from head to heels.
  • Pull your chest towards the rings, squeezing your shoulder blades together, then lower back down.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your body straight and avoid sagging your hips.
  • Focus on pulling with your back, not just your arms.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Adjust the height of the rings to make the movement easier or harder.
  • If rings are too challenging, you can perform inverted rows on a barbell or use a TRX.

    • ---


    Loading and Rep-Modification Options


  • **Sweat:**
  • Row/Ski: 16/8 calories
  • Box Step-Ups: Bodyweight
  • Kettlebell: 12kg/8kg
  • Ring Rows: Bodyweight

  • **Train:**
  • Row/Ski: 20/12 calories
  • Box Step-Ups: Bodyweight or light weights
  • Kettlebell: 16kg/12kg
  • Ring Rows: Bodyweight

  • **Compete:**
  • Row/Ski: 24/16 calories
  • Box Step-Ups: Weighted (hold a dumbbell or kettlebell)
  • Kettlebell: 24kg/16kg
  • Ring Rows: Bodyweight

    • Strategy Advice

  • Focus on maintaining a steady pace throughout the workout. Itâ€™s better to keep moving consistently than to go all out and burn out early.
  • Break up the movements into manageable sets if needed, especially on the kettlebell pulls and ring rows.
  • Remember to breathe and stay hydrated!

    • ---


    Alright team, letâ€™s get after it today! Focus on quality, keep your form sharp, and have fun! Youâ€™ve got this! ðŸ’ª

combined_content.title: CrossFit MINS Workout

For Quality

6 Rounds:

  • 20 Box Step-ups
  • 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
  • 10 Ring Rows

    • Sweat: 16/8

    Train: 20/12

    Compete: 24/16
